channel.title: [b]HELP ME HOW DO I CHANGE STARTER I GIVE AMAZING REP![/b]
channel.description: [b]how do i change starter post here please good rep coming ur way if you help me =][/b]

item.title: [b]HELP ME HOW DO I CHANGE STARTER I GIVE AMAZING REP![/b]
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Ddragonimp, post:7, topic:227745”]Note this has been tested for Devolution and Dodian Servers

one thing u could do it is on start up…
after somthing like this
public static boolean AutoSave = false;
or
public int AttackingOn = 0;

Go ahead and add this line
public int starter = 0;

place this code after
IPPart4 = Integer.parseInt(playerLastConnect.substring(
(start[2] + 1), (start[3])));
} catch (NumberFormatException e) {
}
}
}

Write somthing like this

if (starter == 0) {
then addItem(itemID, ItemAmount);
starter = 1
}

and then after somthing like this
} else if (token.equals(“character-rating”)) {
rating = Integer.parseInt(token2);
write
} else if (token.equals(“character-starter”)) {
starter = Integer.parseInt(token2);

then after somthing that looks like this
characterfile.write("character-rating = ", 0, 19);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(rating), 0, Integer.toString(
rating).length());
characterfile.newLine();

Write this

		characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);  // NOTE I DID CHANGE THE 19 TO A 20
		characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0, Integer.toString(
				starter).length());
		characterfile.newLine();[/quote]

please read the date.
2. use code tags.

Read full topic

item.title: [b]HELP ME HOW DO I CHANGE STARTER I GIVE AMAZING REP![/b]
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Note this has been tested for Devolution and Dodian Servers

one thing u could do it is on start up…
after somthing like this
public static boolean AutoSave = false;
or
public int AttackingOn = 0;

Go ahead and add this line
public int starter = 0;

place this code after
IPPart4 = Integer.parseInt(playerLastConnect.substring(
(start[2] + 1), (start[3])));
} catch (NumberFormatException e) {
}
}
}

Write somthing like this

if (starter == 0) {
then addItem(itemID, ItemAmount);
starter = 1
}

and then after somthing like this
} else if (token.equals(“character-rating”)) {
rating = Integer.parseInt(token2);
write
} else if (token.equals(“character-starter”)) {
starter = Integer.parseInt(token2);

then after somthing that looks like this
characterfile.write("character-rating = ", 0, 19);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(rating), 0, Integer.toString(
rating).length());
characterfile.newLine();

Write this

		characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);  // NOTE I DID CHANGE THE 19 TO A 20
		characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0, Integer.toString(
				starter).length());
		characterfile.newLine();

item.title: [b]HELP ME HOW DO I CHANGE STARTER I GIVE AMAZING REP![/b]
item.dc:creator: @WrittenBlade WrittenBlade
item.description:
@WrittenBlade wrote:

[quote=“Rog3r, post:5, topic:227745”]Ermm yes.

It doesn’t save, you can do it over and over again.
From what that code shows us, it will not save.[/quote]
Wouldn’t you want to declare a starter (public int starter == 0), and have it save into your char file?

So -

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter") && starter == 0) { starter = 1; addItem(ITEM ID, ITEM AMOUNT); sendMessage("MESSAGE"); } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("MESSAGE"); }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ash_dude34 ash dude34
item.description:
@ash_dude34 wrote:

open up client.java and search for

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {

under that it shud come up with:

addItem(995, 100000000);
addItem(ITEMID, ITEMAMOUNT);
addItem(ITEMID, ITEMAMOUNT);

*change the item id to the item id u want and then the item amount then compile ur server restart and then run
